msContents.summary: Letter to Zenon about some wheat that did not correspond to the sample furnished to Zenon, but was mixed with barley; the writer did not know whether to sell it or to transport it to Memphis; he also says that no one is to move into his house

msItemStruct.note: 22 lines written on the front along the fibers; the letter continues on the back across the fibers with 6 lines, but the address is along the fibers
The hand is fast, inclined to the right, with many ligatures, and uses a thick pen

supportDesc.support: 3papyrus fragments ; fr.a 8.8 x 13.5 + b 2 x 3 + c 8.2 x 9.4 cm

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from Dr. Kondilios through H.I. Bell in December 1926; no. 99 in Bell's inventory

keywords.term: Agenor, -- strategos, 2 in Pap.Lugd.Bat. XXI, p. 275

div.ab: [1-11]- - to send you the sample of the wheat. I sent it to you. Now they did not give us the same grain as the sample which I sent you, but they have been giving us another quality with which barley is mixed. Thrasymedes is cleaning it and taking a sample. [17-25] [I was in doubt whether] to sell it rather than to transport it down to Memphis because of the expenses (connected therewith). Therefore write me because the dealers are at hand. Also write to Agenor about my house, to let no one move into it - - To Zenon.
